instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936B: What is 820-2936B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 15v
threads.message:
Hi Team,

I have a strange issue on that board:

First I had a lot of issue on that board and replaced many components because of no green light no PPBUS: <CAPACITOR>C6999</CAPACITOR>, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> etc....
Then I had <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at 15V without green light so I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>, when I took them out and mesured the resistance between Pin 5 and 1,2,3 I had almost a short: 1.2 Ohms for <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and OL for <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> but if i compared with new one the same mesurements are around 40 Ohms.

Then I reflowed the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area for the components to replace themself ( maybe bad soldering contact ).

Now I have the green light, the board is starting ( fan spinning ) [B]BUT <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is still 15.55V[/B]
Tried with 85W and 60W official chargers.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 15v
threads.message:
Still short D-S on <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>; change it.
Be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR> are OK and pin 24/<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is properly soldered.
You may need to change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> too...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 15v
threads.message:
Replaced once more <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.66V and PP3V42 is OK green light OK, fan spinning, just have to check the board back in the chassis and lcd because I plugged a speaker without RAM memory and it's not beeping .....and normaly it should beep without RAM Memory.
Thanks gracia merci so far 2 informaticos like usually......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 15v
threads.message:
Everything Fine and OK

Can close the topic

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 15v
threads.message:
For the future, an USB mouse is good enough to detect an working board on the desk.
Sometime USB mouse can cheat you, so I recommend to use a pendrive with OSX installed.
Pendrive should have LED; if flashes, board is loading OSX...
